title: [Large-scale] Digital Twin and Reinforcement Learning-based Process Planning and Scheduling for Service-oriented Production

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Engineering and Manufacturing Systems Knowledge, Elementary Programming Skills
context.additional_context: Learners study flexible production system design methods responsive to diverse customer requirements and market changes. Focuses on developing real-time decision-making and process optimization skills using digital twins and reinforcement learning

learning_goals: Explain the role of digital twins in service-based production environments and design process monitoring systems
Solve process scheduling problems by applying deep reinforcement learning (Deep-Q-Learning) algorithms
Select optimal RL design approaches tailored to fluctuating production conditions (e.g., small-batch multi-product/large-scale continuous production)
Perform project-based learning tasks in large-scale learner environments using LMS-based collaboration tools
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
